page.title: 04STANDISH
page.content: The parish of Standish is very spread out. There is a population of between two and three hundred. In the village, one of the main features is the Almonry and the 14th century church which lie next to each other. The monks used to live in the Almonry and pray in the Church. The Almonry is now the headquarters of the Gloucestershire Trust for Nature Conservation. There are two offices and a shop open to the public. Three famous people are connected with Standish: Princess Diana, Winston Churchill and Bishop Frampton who is buried in the church.
